required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Resistance Training in Cardiovascular Disease Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Resistance Training in Coronary Artery Disease and Heart Failure Patients Undergoing Cardiac Rehabilitation

brief_summary.textblock: In this study coronary artery disease patients and patients with heart failure will be randomly assigned to three training groups: combined aerobic interval training with high intensity resistance training, combined aerobic interval training with low intensity resistance training and aerobic interval training.

detailed_description.textblock:
Exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation programmes have predominantly used aerobic-dynamic exercise modalities, whereas resistance training have been discouraged in patients with cardiovascular disease, due to safety concerns related to cardiovascular response (heart rate and blood pressure) during the exertion. Contrary to such concerns, recent hemodynamic studies have reported lower blood pressure and heart rate during higher intensity resistance training (>70 % 1-RM) compared to lower intensity resistance training (>40 % 1-RM). Furthermore, the latest meta analysis have demonstrated that combined resistance training with standard aerobic interval training has been superior than aerobic training alone in several aspects of health.
However, there is still huge heterogeneity in training intervention design, also there still lacks studies to further elucidate the effects of high intensity resistance training combined with aerobic training on physical performance (aerobic capacity, muscle strength, balance), body composition, quality of life, morbidity, mortality, etc. Therefore, the aim of this study was to examine the effects of high (70%-80 % 1-RM) versus low loads (30%- 40 % 1-RM) resistance training in combination with aerobic interval cycling (50 % -80% of baseline peak Power output) in coronary artery disease patients and patients with heart failure.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cluster randomisation with three parallel intervention groups
study_design_info.masking_description: Baseline and post-training measurement will be performed by experienced research nurse and physiotherapist, which will not participate in intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in maximal aerobic capacity at 12 weeks compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Measured as change in VO2 max (ml/kg/min)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Maximal voluntary contraction of knee extensors
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in maximal isometric torque at 12 weeks compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Measured as change in maximal isometric torque of knee extensors

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in HOMA-IR at 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in HOMA IR (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in glucose levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in glucose levels at 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in glucose levels (mmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in insulin levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in insulin levels at 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in insulin levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in systolic blood pressure during high and low load resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of systolic blood pressure during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise) within the first and the last week of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in systolic blood pressure during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise) values

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in diastolic blood pressure during high and low load resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of diastolic blood pressure during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise) within the first and the last week of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in diastolic blood pressure during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in heart rate during high and low load resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of heart rate during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise) within the first and the last week of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in heart rate during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of perceived exertion during high and low load resistance exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of rating of perceived exertion (score 0-10, 0-no exertion, 10-maximal exertion) during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise) within the first and the last week of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change of rating of perceived exertion (0-10) during resistance exercise compared to baseline (pre-exercise)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Short Physical Performance Battery (SPPB) total score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in the Short Physical Performance battery test total score (0-the worse outcome, 12- the best outcome) after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in points of the SPPB after 12 weeks compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time of the "Up and Go" test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in seconds of the "Up and Go" test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change of time (s) in "Up and Go" test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Grip strength test (kg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in kg of Grip strength test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change of kg in Grip strength test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Arm curl test (number of repetitions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in number of repetitions of the Arm curl test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change of number of repetitions in Arm curl test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time of the Sit to stand test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in seconds of the Sit to stand test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in time (s) of the Sit and stand test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in One Leg Heel Raise test (number of repetitions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in number of repetitions of One leg heel raise test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change of number of repetitions in One leg heel raise test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total energy expenditure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in kcal after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in kcal using accelerometry data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sedentary activity level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in minutes of sedentary activity after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in minutes spent in sedentary activity level using accelerometry data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in moderate to vigorous physical activity level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in minutes of moderate to vigorous physical activity after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in minutes spent in moderate to vigorous physical activity level using accelerometry data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Back Scratch test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in cm of the Back Scratch test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in cm of the Back Scratch test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Chair Sit and Reach test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in cm of the Chair sit and Reach test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in cm of the Chair Sit and Reach test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Stork balance test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in seconds of the Stork balance test after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in seconds of the Stork balance test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Short form Health related quality of life questionnaire (SF-12)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in score of the Short form 12 items health related questionnaire (12 points -the lowest score, 47 points the highest score) after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in score of the SF-12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patients health questionnaire score (PHQ-9)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in score of the Patients health 9-item questionnaire (0 points-the best outcome, 27 points-the worse outcome) after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in points of PHQ-9 questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiratory Exchange Ratio (RER)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in % after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as percent change of RER during cardiopulmonary exercise test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ve/VCO2 slope ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in ratio of VE/VCO2 slope after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in VE/VCO2 slope

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha) level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in TNF-alpha level after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in TNF-alpha

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Interleukin 6 (IL-6) level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in IL-6 level after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in IL-6 level

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Human Growth hormone (hGH) level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in hGH level after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in hGH level

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Insulin like Growth Factor 1 (IGF-1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in IGF-1 level after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in IGF-1 level

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in N-terminal-pro brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in NT-proBNP level after 12 weeks compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as change in NT-proBNP level

clinical_study.condition: Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction

arm_group.arm_group_label: Aerobic interval training with high loads resistance training
arm_group.description: Patient to be randomised into "combined aerobic training with high loads resistance training group".

arm_group.arm_group_label: Aerobic interval training with low loads resistance training
arm_group.description: Patient to be randomised into "combined aerobic training with low loads resistance training group".
Patient to be randomised into "aerobic training training group".

intervention.intervention_name: Aerobic interval training combined with high intensity resistance training
intervention.description: Patients enrolled in arm of the study will perform 12 weeks of combined aerobic interval training (5 intervals of cycling at the intensity of 50 %-80% of peak power obtained at baseline cardiopulmonary testing) combined with high intensity resistance training (3 sets of leg press at the intensity of 70 %- 80 % of one repetition maximum (1-RM)).
intervention.arm_group_label: Aerobic interval training with high loads resistance training
intervention.other_name: Aerobic and high intensity strength training

intervention.intervention_name: Aerobic interval training combined with low intensity resistance training
intervention.description: Patients enrolled in arm of the study will perform 12 weeks of combined aerobic interval training (5 intervals of cycling at the intensity of 50 %-80% of peak power obtained at baseline cardiopulmonary testing) combined with high intensity resistance training (3 sets of leg press at the intensity of 30 %- 40 % 1-RM).
intervention.arm_group_label: Aerobic interval training with low loads resistance training
intervention.other_name: Aerobic and low intensity strength training

intervention.description: Patients enrolled in arm of the study will perform 12 weeks of aerobic interval training (5 intervals of cycling at the intensity of 50 %-80% of peak power obtained at baseline cardiopulmonary testing).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stable patients with documented CAD with clinical event (>1 month after acute coronary syndrome and/or percutaneous coronary intervention) or coronarography and/or
- Stable Heart Failure patients with documented reduced ejection fraction (>40-45 %)
- age >18 years
- NYHA class I-III
- Cardiopulmonary exercise test without ECG abnormalities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable CHD
- Decompensated HF
- Uncontrolled arrhythmias
- Severe and symptomatic aortic stenosis
- Acute myocarditis, endocarditis, or pericarditis
- Aortic dissection
- Marfan syndrome
- Musculoskeletal limitations
